document.masterDocTitle: Descriptions of larvae of the tribe Hyperini (Coleoptera: Curculionidae): III. Mature larvae of the genus Donus Jekel, 1865

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Descriptions of larvae of the tribe Hyperini (Coleoptera: Curculionidae): III. Mature larvae of the genus Donus Jekel, 1865

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 50–56.
Donus palumbarius
. (50) head, (51) labium and maxilla, (52) maxilla, (53) mandible, (54) thorax, (55) abdominal segment IV, (56) abdominal segment IX; Figs 50, 52–53 dorsal view, Fig. 51 ventral view and Figs 54– 56 lateral view. Scale bar 0.1 mm: a – Figs 54–56; b – Fig. 50; c – Figs 51–52; d – Fig. 53.

FIGURES 57–63.
Donus reichei
. (57) head, (58) labium and maxilla, (59) maxilla, (60) mandible, (61) thorax, (62) abdominal segment IV, (63) abdominal segment IX; Figs 57, 59–60 dorsal view, Fig. 58 ventral view and Figs 61–63 lateral view. Scale bar 0.1 mm: a – Figs 61–63; b – Fig. 57; c – Figs 58–59; d – Fig. 60.

subSubSection.paragraph: COLORATION. Head pale brown maculate, posterior margin of epicranium dark. Dorsal side of body green with slightly white median stripe.
THORAX. Spiracle with oval airtubes oriented postriad.
ABDOMEN. Spiracles with oval airtubes oriented posterio-dorsad.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 64–70.
Donus tesselatus
. (64) head, (65) labium and maxilla, (66) maxilla, (67) mandible, (68) thorax, (69) abdominal segment IV, (70) abdominal segment IX; Figs 64, 66–67 dorsal view, Fig. 65 ventral view and Figs 68–70 lateral view. Scale bar 0.1 mm: a—Figs 68–70; b—Fig. 64; c—Figs 65–66; d—Fig. 67.

Remarks.
Dieckmann ( 1989 )
recorded only coloration of the body and setae; his data agree with that presented here.
